paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.424G>A (p.Val142Ile) including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.demographics: healthy unrelated individuals, predominantly female, from Puerto Rican, African American, and Dominican backgrounds
patients.phenotype: transthyretin amyloidosis typically manifests after age 60 with renal amyloidosis and cardiomyopathy

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with transthyretin amyloidosis, which typically presents with renal amyloidosis and cardiomyopathy.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on literature review and clinical significance.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is noted to disproportionately affect African Americans.
key_quotes: transthyretin amyloidosis (TTRNM_000371.3:c.424G>A(p.Val142Ile)) that typically manifests after age 60 with renal amyloidosis and cardiomyopathy

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one variant in the TTR gene was found in the text.
